info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 16 at 3:51AM EDT until May 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS AND NORTHWESTERN CONNECTICUT... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS AND NORTHWESTERN CONNECTICUT... The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a Red Flag Warning for low humidities and gusty winds, which is in effect from 8 AM this morning to 8 PM EDT this evening. * Affected Area...In Massachusetts, Berkshire County. In Connecticut, Litchfield County. * Timing...For the Red Flag Warning, today with the most critical conditions between late morning and sunset. For the Fire Weather Watch, on Wednesday with the most critical conditions between late morning and sunset. * Winds...Today, west-southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. On Wednesday, northwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...Today and on Wednesday, as low as 20 percent. * Temperatures...Today, in the upper 60s to upper 70s. On Wednesday, in the upper 40s to upper 50s. * Lightning...None. * Impacts...Dry conditions and gusty winds may result in rapid fire spread if ignition occurs.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
